Zachariah or Zacharias__03.1:
And the Lord shewed me<u>
                Jesus
               </u>the high priest standing before the angel of the Lord: and Satan stood on his right hand to be his adversary.
Zachariah or Zacharias__03.2: And the Lord said to Satan: The Lord rebuke thee, O Satan: and the Lord that chose Jerusalem rebuke thee: Is not this a brand plucked out of the fire?
Zachariah or Zacharias__03.3:
And Jesus was clothed<u>
                with filthy garments
               </u>: and he stood before the face of the angel.
Zachariah or Zacharias__03.4: Who answered, and said to them that stood before him, saying: Take away the filthy garments from him. And he said to him: Behold I have taken away thy iniquity, and have clothed thee with change of garments.
Zachariah or Zacharias__03.5: And he said: Put a clean mitre upon his head: and they put a clean mitre upon his head, and clothed him with garments, and the angel of the Lord stood.
Zachariah or Zacharias__03.6: And the angel of the Lord protested to Jesus, saying:
Zachariah or Zacharias__03.7:
Thus saith the Lord of hosts: If thou wilt walk in my ways, and keep my charge, thou also shalt judge my house, and shalt keep my courts, and<u>
                I will give thee
               </u>some of them that are now present here to walk with thee.
Zachariah or Zacharias__03.8:
Hear, O Jesus thou high priest, thou and thy friends that dwell before thee, for they are<u>
                portending men
               </u>: for behold I WILL BRING<u>
                MY SERVANT THE ORIENT
               </u>.
Zachariah or Zacharias__03.9:
For behold<u>
                the stone
               </u>that I have laid before Jesus: upon one stone there are<u>
                seven eyes
               </u>: behold I will grave the graving thereof, saith the Lord of hosts: and I will take away the iniquity of that land in<u>
                one day
               </u>.
Zachariah or Zacharias__03.10: In that day, saith the Lord of hosts, every man shall call his friend under the vine and under the fig tree.
